newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian GDP grows 3.6 pct first 9 mths of 1996.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian GDP grows 3.6 pct first 9 mths of 1996.

text.p: Lithuania's gross domestic product grew 3.6 percent to 22,516 million litas in the first nine months of 1996, according to preliminary data released by the Statistics Department (SD) on Thursday.
SD said in a report that GDP in the third quarter of 1996 was 8,532 million litas, an increase of 22 percent on the second quarter of the year.
Seasonal factors were behind the big third quarter growth, SD said, with favourable weather leading to higher agricultural production.
Overall growth of industry, construction and trade as well as increased demand in hotel and communication services accounted for the growth.
